paper.title: SiBo-The Sign Bot, Connected World for Disabled
paper.abstract: Sign Language has proven to be a leap forward in enabling a communication medium for mute and hard-of-hearing people, yet it is not a recognized language among others, making the challenged ones feel socially excluded. In this paper, the proposed assistive device - SiBo, brings the power of embedded AI to a subset of people, often sidelined when delivering mainstream technology. This proposed device exploits the capabilities of Infineon's Sense2GoL radar and its MCU portfolio in interpreting and recognizing the visual-manual modality of communication - American Sign Language (ASL) to control the smart home components. This work explores the state-of-the-art radar technology in gesture recognition and proposes an edge deployable deep neural network model with a small memory footprint. The developed model extensively uses ML pipeline services offered by Edge Impulse enabling faster prototyping methods for such edge applications. It is capable of classifying the input ASL gestures in real-time with an accuracy of 89.4% and inference latency of 2 ms. The already existing methods utilize high-end cameras to capture hand gestures. But, they being susceptible to adverse weather conditions and posing an added risk of privacy breaches or data vulnerabilities makes it less favorable in such applications and hence gives an edge to radar technology.
relevant_keywords: edge deployable deep neural network model

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究的是利用雷达技术和深度学习模型进行手语识别，以帮助残障人士控制智能家居设备，并未涉及衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等金融领域。
